This is the detection submodel with properly specified logistic priors, a quadratic effect on date, and the effect of vegetation density (f = .70)

**Model structure:**

Naive state model:
$$
z_i \sim Bernoulli(\psi)
$$ 

Process model with four covariates:  

$$
y_{ij} \sim Bernoulli(p| \beta_{date}, \beta_{date}^2,\beta_{avg db}, \beta_{effort})
$$

**Handling of NAs:** imputation

This model c

Load in formatted data

```{r Load in Data}
full_dat <- readRDS(file ="C:/Users/annak/OneDrive/Documents/UM/Research/Coding_Workspace/Cuckoo-Research/Data/Habitat_Model_Covariates/Full_DetectionDataSCALED_JAGSModels_HabChap.Rdata")
```

Set up data for model 

```{R Specify Data for Model}
# Pull out the detections so that you have n_unit and n_site
detections_only <- full_dat[,2:7]

# Have to specify the z data for a true presence if there was a 1 at any time 
z_dat <- rowSums(detections_only, na.rm = T)
z_dat[z_dat > 1] <- 1
z_dat[z_dat == 0] <- NA

# Create a list of data for JAGS
jags_data <- list(
  # True presence at sites with confirmed presences
  Z = z_dat,
  # Detection/nondetection data
  det_data = detections_only,
  # Date
  cov1 = full_dat[,21:26],
  # Background noise
  cov3 = full_dat[,8:13],
  # Effort 
  cov4 = full_dat[,15:20],
  n_unit = nrow(detections_only),
  n_rep = ncol(detections_only)
)

# Set initial values \
init_func5 <- function(){
  list(
    a0 = rnorm(1, 0, 1),
    b0 = rnorm(1, 0, 1),
    b1 = rnorm(1, 0, 1),
    b1Q = rnorm(1, 0 ,1),
    b3 = rnorm(1, 0, 1),
    b4 = rnorm(1, 0, 1)
  )
}
```



```{R Set Up Model 4, eval = FALSE}
# b1/cov1: date
# b2/cov2: veg density
# b3/cov3: background noise
# b4/cov4: effort

# Create the jags_model
cat("
  model{
      # Priors
    a0 ~ dlogis(0, 1)
    b0 ~ dlogis(0, 1)
    b1 ~ dlogis(0, 1)
    b1Q ~ dlogis(0, 1)
    b3 ~ dlogis(0, 1)
    b4 ~ dlogis(0, 1)
    
    # Loop through each sampling unit
    for(i in 1:n_unit){
      Z[i] ~ dbern(psi[i])  # Presence or absence drawn from a bernoulli distribution with occupancy probability psi  
      logit(psi[i]) <- a0
      
      
      for(j in 1:n_rep){
        cov1[i,j] ~ dnorm(0, 1) # Assuming normal distribution for missing covariates
        cov3[i,j] ~ dnorm(0, 1) # Assuming normal distribution for missing covariates
        cov4[i,j] ~ dnorm(0, 1) # Assuming normal distribution for missing covariates
        
        det_data[i,j] ~  dbern(Z[i]*theta[i,j])  # Create detection data drawn from a bernoulli distribution incorporating the true presence (Z) with probability of detection theta
        logit(theta[i,j]) <- b0 + b1*cov1[i,j] + b1Q*(cov1[i,j]^2) + b3*cov3[i,j] + b4*cov4[i,j]
        
      }
    }
  } 
  ", file = "C:/Users/annak/OneDrive/Documents/UM/Research/Coding_Workspace/Cuckoo-Research/R_Scripts/2_Analyses/Habitat_Chapter/Detection_Submodel/Model_Structure_Files/JAGS_HabDetMod6.txt")
```


```{R Run Model 5}
habdet_m6 <- jags(data = jags_data, 
                 model.file = "C:/Users/annak/OneDrive/Documents/UM/Research/Coding_Workspace/Cuckoo-Research/R_Scripts/2_Analyses/Habitat_Chapter/Detection_Submodel/Model_Structure_Files/JAGS_HabDetMod6.txt",
                 parameters.to.save = c("a0", "b0", "b1", "b1Q", "b3", "b4"),
                 n.iter = 10000, 
                 n.burnin = 4000, 
                 n.chains = 3,
                 n.thin = 2,
                 #parallel = TRUE,
                 inits = init_func5)

print(habdet_m6)
```

Interpreting this: what does quadratic do?

```{R Create Violin Plots}
# Plot posterior distribution
chains_m6 <- jags_df(habdet_m6)
# Select the chains for our covariates of interest
chains_viol <- chains_m6 %>% select(b1,b1Q,b3,b4)
# Rename them to be more interpretable
colnames(chains_viol) <- c("date","quadratic date","background_noise","effort")
# Pivot this longer so that we can visualize it
chains_viol_long <- chains_viol %>% pivot_longer(cols = c("date","quadratic date","background_noise","effort"),names_to = "Parameter", values_to = "Values")

# Create the violin plot
ggplot() +
  geom_violin(data=chains_viol_long, aes(x = Parameter, y = Values,fill = Parameter),trim = FALSE) +
  labs(title = "Posterior Distribution of Detection Covariates") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("date"=palette_5[1], "quadratic date" = palette_5[5],"background_noise"=palette_5[2], "effort" = palette_5[3])) + 
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0, linetype = "solid", color = "black") +
  theme_minimal()
```

```{R Extract WAIC}
# Extract samples from the posterior
m6_s <- jags.samples(habdet_m6$model,
                           c("WAIC","deviance"),
                           type = "mean",
                           n.iter = 5000,
                           n.burnin = 1000,
                           n.thin = 2)
# Duplicate WAIC samples - the WAIC is the posterior mean for that sample?
m6_s$p_waic <- m6_s$WAIC
# Calculate a new waic by adding the waic plus the deviance
m6_s$waic_calc <- m6_s$deviance + m6_s$p_waic
# Create a new vector of the sum across each array (sum WAIC, sum deviance, sum p_waic, and sum waic_calc)
tmp <- sapply(m6_s, sum)
# Pull out the sum of the WAIC we calculated and the p_waic we duplicated
waic_m6 <- round(c(waic = tmp[["waic_calc"]], p_waic = tmp[["p_waic"]]),1)
# Calculate the standard error for WAIC
m6_waic_se <- sd(m6_s$waic_calc)/(sqrt(length(m6_s$waic_calc)))

waic_m6
m6_waic_se
```
